newsitem.title: USA: Chicago mayor rips alderman's possible conflicts.
newsitem.headline: Chicago mayor rips alderman's possible conflicts.

text.p: Chicago Mayor Richard Daley on Thursday criticized influential Alderman Edward Burke for filing lawsuits for private clients that attack the budget and tax packages he has helped adopt as the City Council's finance committee chairman, Chicago newspapers reported Friday.
The Chicago Sun-Times reported Thursday that Burke is one of a handful of attorneys who represent clients seeking property tax refunds before various agencies.
Burke's claims include contentions of flaws in the city budgets that he has helped prepare, the Sun-Times said. The alderman has denied any wrongdoing or conflict-of-interest.
Daley told reporters Thursday that an alderman should correct errors he sees during the budget process and said, "Someone's going to be looking at this."

Earlier this year, a former alderman admitted as part of an ongoing federal probe that he held ghost payrolling jobs with three City Council committees while employed as an attorney in Burke's law firm.
